title.rendered: Richmond Champion: Net Worth 2023, Career Earnings

content.rendered:
Summary

  • About Richmond Champion
    • Early Career
    • Professional Career
  • Richmond Champion’s Net Worth in 2023
    • Career Earnings
    • Endorsements
  • Personal Details
    • Wife
    • How Old is Richmond Champion?
    • What is his nationality?
    • FAQs About Richmond Champion

Richmond “Richie” Champion (born December 16, 1992) is an American professional rodeo cowboy who specializes in bareback bronc riding. He became the first bareback rider to earn $1 million at a single rodeo. Born in Orange County, California, Champion has made a name for himself in the rodeo world, with multiple National Finals Rodeo (NFR) qualifications and significant career earnings.

Here you can follow Richmond Champion’s net worth, career earnings, professional career, achievements, relationship status, and more.

About Richmond Champion

Richmond Champion was born on December 16, 1992, in Orange County, California, to Greg, a hotel company executive, and Lori, a consultant who competed in show jumping while in college.

The family moved between Texas, Arizona, Washington State, and Alaska during Champion’s childhood. He began taking lessons in Western riding at the age of 10 and showed great talent, eventually transitioning to bull riding in junior high.

Early Career

Champion started his rodeo career in high school, winning the Texas High School Rodeo Association bareback title in his senior year in 2011.

He earned a rodeo scholarship to Tarleton State University in Stephenville, Texas, where he attended for three years. 

After graduating from high school, Champion joined the Professional Rodeo Cowboys Association (PRCA) and competed on the PRCA rodeo circuit, winning several small rodeos.

Professional Career

Richmond Champion has had a successful professional career as a rodeo cowboy specializing in bareback bronc riding. He joined the Professional Rodeo Cowboys Association (PRCA) after graduating from high school and won several small rodeos.

In 2014, he had a breakthrough season, placing at major rodeos such as the Fort Worth Stock Show, San Antonio Stock Show & Rodeo, and National Western Stock Show.

That same year, he won the inaugural The American Rodeo in Arlington, Texas, earning the nickname “Million-Dollar Cowboy” after winning the top prize of $1.1 million.

Champion has qualified for the National Finals Rodeo (NFR) eight times. In 2019, he finished fourth in the world standings with $238,983, placing third in the Wrangler NFR average and earning $108,154.

He has also won several other major rodeos, including Rodeo Houston, PRCA Xtreme Bares and Broncs, Calgary Stampede, Lea County Fair Rodeo, and Horse Heaven Roundup Rodeo.

Despite facing a herniated disc that required surgery in 2022, Champion made a strong comeback, qualifying for his eighth NFR and adjusting his rodeo schedule to balance his personal life and professional career.

Richmond Champion’s Net Worth in 2023

As of 2023, Richmond Champion’s net worth is estimated to be $1 million.

His career earnings in the PRCA exceed $954,000.

Career Earnings

Richmond Champion has had a successful career in rodeo, with significant earnings to his name. As of 2023, his career earnings amount to $1,554,630. 

This includes earnings from his participation in various rodeos and championships. Notably, in 2014, he won the inaugural The American Rodeo in Arlington, Texas, earning the top prize of $1.1 million.

This win earned him the nickname “Million-Dollar Cowboy”. In the 2019 season, he finished fourth in the world standings with $238,983, placing third in the Wrangler NFR average and earning $108,154.

In the 2021 season, his earnings added up to $98,945.01. Despite a herniated disc that required surgery in 2022, Champion still managed to earn $26,726.43 in winnings that year.

Endorsements

Richmond Champion is a brand ambassador for Yeti, Hooey Hats, and Tony Lama Boots.

Personal Details

Wife

Richmond Champion is married to Paige Lawrence Champion, a former Olympic figure skater who represented Canada at the Sochi Winter Olympics in 2014. 

How Old is Richmond Champion?

Richmond Champion is 30 years old as of 2023.

What is his nationality?

He is American.

FAQs About Richmond Champion

What is Richmond Champion’s main rodeo event?

Richmond Champion specializes in bareback bronc riding.

How many times has he qualified for the National Finals Rodeo (NFR)?

He has qualified for the NFR four times (2014, 2016-2018).

What brands does he endorse?

He is a brand ambassador for Yeti, Hooey Hats, and Tony Lama Boots.
